result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Jail (First 30 days Straight Time, Last 30 days with Huber   Huber with standard release conditions).

miscConds.notes:
Buy Money of $90.00 to be paid within the First 30 Days as a Condition of Probation.

Cash Bail Applied to DNA Surcharge Paid In Full.  Cash Bail of $250.00 Applied to Costs Costs the remaining $18.00 to be paid within 30 Days as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations within the next two (2) years.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Complete Anger Management Course.
No contact with Kevin L.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

Case #14CM111 was Dismissed and Read into #14CF155.
